rules.title: Height measurement dependency for porches and entry features

qualifiers.description: Applies to all porch and entry features depicted in Figure 4 for which height is referenced.
Measurement of height used to classify porch/entry feature types.

variables.name: height_above_grade
variables.description: Vertical height of the porch or entry feature measured from grade, per external referenced method.

constants.name: measurement_procedure_reference
constants.description: Authoritative method for measuring height of porches and entry features.

conditions.if: Height is to be used for classification or compliance checks for porch/entry features.
conditions.then: Measure height_above_grade per the procedure in Figures 6–8 on pp. 11–13 before applying classification rules.
conditions.notes: This establishes a dependency for all subsequent rules that use height.

relationships.description: R2–R4 rely on the height measurement method referenced by R1.

rules.title: Roofed entry way (not vaulted) classification and height criterion

qualifiers.description: Roofed entry features that are not vaulted (Figure 4, Panel B).
Used to classify an entry way as 'roofed (not vaulted)' and to validate height against the defined threshold.
Vaulted entry ways and combination porch & vaulted entry ways are excluded.

variables.name: height_above_grade
variables.description: Height of the entry feature above grade, measured per R1.

variables.name: vaulted
variables.description: Indicates whether the entry way is vaulted.

variables.name: feature_category
variables.description: Categorical type assigned to the feature.

constants.name: height_threshold_non_vaulted
constants.description: Upper bound threshold for non-vaulted roofed entry way height.
constants.source: Figure 4, Panel B note: 'Height less than 12' above grade'

conditions.notes: Defines required attributes if the feature is already labeled as a roofed, non-vaulted entry way.
conditions.ambiguity_notes: Boundary case when height_above_grade == 12 ft is not specified.

conditions.if: feature is an entry way, is roofed, vaulted == false, and height_above_grade < 12 ft
conditions.notes: Provides forward classification logic from measured height and attributes.
conditions.ambiguity_notes: Behavior at exactly height_above_grade == 12 ft is unspecified.

relationships.description: Relies on R1 for how height_above_grade is measured.
Non-vaulted and vaulted entry classifications are mutually exclusive with respect to height thresholds.

rules.title: Vaulted entry way classification and height criterion

qualifiers.description: Used to classify an entry way as 'vaulted' and to validate height against the defined threshold.
Non-vaulted roofed entry ways and standalone roofed porches are excluded.

variables.name: height_above_grade
variables.description: Height of the entry feature above grade, measured per R1.

variables.name: vaulted
variables.description: Indicates whether the entry way is vaulted.

variables.name: feature_category
variables.description: Categorical type assigned to the feature.

constants.name: height_threshold_vaulted
constants.description: Lower bound threshold for vaulted entry way height (strictly greater than).
constants.source: Figure 4, Panel C note: 'Height greater than 12' above grade'

conditions.notes: Defines required attributes if the feature is already labeled as a vaulted entry way.
conditions.ambiguity_notes: Boundary case when height_above_grade == 12 ft is not specified.

conditions.if: feature is an entry way, is roofed, vaulted == true, and height_above_grade > 12 ft
conditions.notes: Provides forward classification logic from measured height and attributes.
conditions.ambiguity_notes: Behavior at exactly height_above_grade == 12 ft is unspecified.

relationships.description: Relies on R1 for how height_above_grade is measured.
Vaulted and non-vaulted entry classifications are mutually exclusive with respect to height thresholds.
Both R3 and R4 use a 'greater than 12 ft' height criterion.

rules.title: Combination porch and vaulted entry way classification and height criterion

qualifiers.description: Features that combine a porch with a vaulted entry way (Figure 4, Panel D).
Used to classify combined porch and vaulted entry features and validate their height.
Standalone porches and standalone entry ways (vaulted or non-vaulted) when not combined.

variables.name: height_above_grade
variables.description: Height of the combined entry feature above grade, measured per R1.

variables.name: includes_porch
variables.description: Indicates that a porch component is present.

variables.name: vaulted
variables.description: Indicates that the entry component is vaulted.

variables.name: feature_category
variables.description: Categorical type assigned to the feature.

constants.name: height_threshold_combination
constants.description: Lower bound threshold for the combination feature height (strictly greater than).
constants.source: Figure 4, Panel D note: 'Height greater than 12' above grade'

conditions.then: height_above_grade > 12 ft AND includes_porch == true AND vaulted == true
conditions.notes: Defines required attributes if the feature is already labeled as a combination porch & vaulted entry.
conditions.ambiguity_notes: It is not specified whether the height pertains to the entry portion only or the combined structure.

conditions.if: includes_porch == true AND vaulted == true AND height_above_grade > 12 ft
conditions.notes: Provides forward classification logic when both a porch and vaulted entry are present.
conditions.ambiguity_notes: Behavior at exactly height_above_grade == 12 ft is unspecified; scope of 'height' within combined feature is unclear.

relationships.description: Relies on R1 for how height_above_grade is measured.
Combination feature includes a vaulted entry way component.

rules.title: Roofed porch category (no explicit dimensional criteria provided on this page)

qualifiers.description: Roofed porch as a feature type (Figure 4, Panel A).
Identification of a roofed porch category.
Entry ways (vaulted or non-vaulted) and combination porch & vaulted entry features.

variables.name: feature_category
variables.description: Categorical type assigned to the feature.

conditions.if: Feature is identified as a roofed porch
conditions.then: No dimensional, height, or material criteria are specified on this page.
conditions.notes: Further criteria, if any, are not visible on this page.
conditions.ambiguity_notes: No height or measurement criteria are given for roofed porches in the provided text.

relationships.description: All are categories under Figure 4 'Types of porches and entry ways'.

validation_summary.completeness: All identifiable rules and classifications from the provided text have been extracted, including height thresholds and dependencies.
validation_summary.accuracy: Numeric threshold captured precisely as 12 ft; greater-than/less-than conditions preserved.
validation_summary.relationships: Dependencies on measurement reference and mutual exclusivity/composition mapped.
validation_summary.hierarchy: Rules grouped conceptually under Figure 4 categories.
ambiguities_flagged: Exact boundary at height == 12 ft is unspecified.
For combination features, whether the referenced height applies to the entry component only or the combined structure is unclear.
No criteria provided for roofed porch beyond its identification.
